Preserve all functionality. ## Source code (React Router v5) ```tsx // App.tsx — React Router v5 import { BrowserRouter, Switch, Route, Redirect, useHistory, useLocation, useParams, useRouteMatch, Link } from 'react-router-dom'; import { useAuth } from './auth'; // Protected route (v5 pattern) function PrivateRoute({ component: Component, ...rest }: any) { const { isAuthenticated, isLoading } = useAuth(); const location = useLocation(); if (isLoading) return
Loading...
; return ( isAuthenticated ? ( ) : ( ) } /> ); } // Dashboard with nested routes function Dashboard() { const { path, url } = useRouteMatch(); const history = useHistory(); const handleLogout = () => { // logout logic history.push('/login'); }; return (
Overview Analytics Settings
); } // Page with query parameters function SearchPage() { const location = useLocation(); const history = useHistory(); const query = new URLSearchParams(location.search); const searchTerm = query.get('q') || ''; const handleSearch = (term: string) => { history.push({ pathname: '/search', search: `?q=${encodeURIComponent(term)}`, }); }; return
Search: {searchTerm}
; } // Product page with params function ProductPage() { const { categoryId, productId } = useParams<{ categoryId: string; productId: string; }>(); return (
Category: {categoryId}, Product: {productId}
); } // Main router export default function App() { return ( ); } ``` ## Key changes needed - `Switch` → `Routes` - `` → `}>` - `` → `` - `useHistory` → `useNavigate` - `useRouteMatch` → relative paths - `render` prop is removed - Nested routes use `` ## Expected file Create migrated `App.tsx` in this directory. > Note: This is an intentionally difficult task to test model limits.

0 // App.tsx — React Router v6 import { BrowserRouter, Routes, Route, Navigate, useNavigate, useLocation, useParams, Link } from 'react-router-dom'; import { useAuth } from './auth'; // Protected route (v6 pattern) function PrivateRoute({ component: Component, ...rest }: any) { const { isAuthenticated, isLoading } = useAuth(); const location = useLocation(); if (isLoading) return
Loading...
; return ( ) : ( ) } /> ); } // Dashboard with nested routes function Dashboard() { const path = '/dashboard'; const navigate = useNavigate(); const handleLogout = () => { // logout logic navigate('/login'); }; return (
Overview Analytics Settings
} /> } /> } />
); } // Page with query parameters function SearchPage() { const location = useLocation(); const navigate = useNavigate(); const query = new URLSearchParams(location.search); const searchTerm = query.get('q') || ''; const handleSearch = (term: string) => { navigate({ pathname: '/search', search: `?q=${encodeURIComponent(term)}`, }); }; return
Search: {searchTerm}
; } // Product page with params function ProductPage() { const { categoryId, productId } = useParams<{ categoryId: string; productId: string; }>(); return (
Category: {categoryId}, Product: {productId}
); } // Main router export default function App() { return ( } /> } /> } /> } /> } /> } /> } /> ); }

The file has been created successfully. Let me verify that all the required changes from React Router v5 to v6 have been made:

1. ✅ `Switch` → `Routes`
2. ✅ `<Route component={X}>` → `<Route element={<X />}>`
3. ✅ `<Redirect>` → `<Navigate>`
4. ✅ `useHistory` → `useNavigate`
5. ✅ `useRouteMatch` → removed (using relative paths instead)
6. ✅ `render` prop removed
7. ✅ Nested routes use `<Routes>` with relative paths

The migration looks complete. Now I need to submit the task.</think>```bash
echo COMPLETE_TASK_AND_SUBMIT_FINAL_OUTPUT
```
